Moving DOWN to (8,7) is a safe move. The new distance to (3,7) would be |8-3| + |7-7| = 5 + 0 = 5.
Moving LEFT to (7,8) is a safe move. The new distance to (3,7) would be |7-3| + |8-7| = 4 + 1 = 5.
Moving RIGHT to (9,8) is a safe move. The new distance to (3,7) would be |9-3| + |8-7| = 6 + 1 = 7.

There is an enemy snake at (5, 8) with a body at (5, 9).
Moving DOWN takes me to (8,7), away from the row (y=8) that the enemy snake is currently on.
Moving LEFT takes me to (7,8), keeping me on the same row (y=8) as the enemy snake, although still two squares away.

To prioritize safety and move towards the closest apple, moving DOWN is the preferred option as it decreases the distance to the apple while also moving away from the immediate vicinity of the enemy snake.

Strategy for next turn: After moving DOWN to (8,7), I will be in a good position to continue moving LEFT towards the closest apple at (3,7). I will assess the board state, particularly the positions of other snakes, before making the subsequent move, prioritizing safety.
